author: Reuters
title: U.S. Traffic Deaths in 2024: A Small Step Forward | Health
text:
U.S. Traffic Deaths in 2024: A Small Step Forward U.S. traffic deaths decreased by 3.2% in the first quarter of 2024, marking the lowest number of fatalities since early 2020. Despite this improvement, the fatality count remains considerably higher than pre-COVID levels, with 8,650 deaths reported compared to 7,901 in the same period of 2020. Reuters | Washington DC | Updated: 24-06-2024 19:51 IST | Created: 24-06-2024 19:51 IST
AI Generated Representative Image Country: United States SHARE U.S. traffic deaths fell 3.2% in the first three months of 2024 -- the lowest number since the same period in 2020 -- but crash fatalities still remain sharply above pre-COVID levels.
The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Monday estimated 8,650 people died in traffic crashes through March 31 this year, which is still significantly higher than the 7,901 people killed in the first three months of 2020. Traffic deaths spiked after the start of COVID-19 and remain elevated but have fallen for two consecutive years.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

author: @GALAfr
title: Cette boisson vantÃ©e pour la perte de poids serait loin d'Ãªtre efficace d'aprÃ¨s Jimmy Mohamed
text:
Cette boisson vantÃ©e pour la perte de poids serait loin dâ€™Ãªtre efficace dâ€™aprÃ¨s Jimmy Mohamed
Les alternatives aux sempiternels sodas ne manquent pas sur le marchÃ© pour limiter sa consommation de sucre. Mais sont-ils rÃ©ellement efficaces ? Jimmy Mohamed passe au crible, cette boisson minceur particuliÃ¨rement prisÃ©e.
Passer la publicitÃ©
Ã€ propos de
Coca Cola, Orangina, Fanta, Oasis... Les boissons sucrÃ©es saturent le marchÃ© alimentaire. Pourtant, leur consommation rÃ©guliÃ¨re peut, Ã  terme, devenir lâ€™origine de maladies telles que le diabÃ¨te de type 2, des maladies cardiaques, des maladies rÃ©nales ou encore lâ€™obÃ©sitÃ©, sans parler des diverses caries dentaires. La raison ? Elles sont trÃ¨s riches en Ã©dulcorants et contiennent diverses formes de sucres ajoutÃ©s comme la cassonade, lâ€™Ã©dulcorant de maÃ¯s, le sirop de maÃ¯s, le dextrose, le fructose, le glucose, le lactose, le maltose, la mÃ©lasse, le sucre brut ou encore le saccharose. Autant dâ€™aliments qui accÃ©lÃ¨rent le processus du vieillissement cutanÃ© via le phÃ©nomÃ¨ne de la Â« glycation Â» et dÃ©cuplent les radicaux libres prÃ©sents dans notre organisme. Et si leurs alternatives Â« sans sucres Â» ont depuis envahi les supermarchÃ©s, elles ne seraient pas nÃ©cessairement meilleures pour la santÃ©, en particulier le Coca Light ou ZÃ©ro. InterrogÃ© sur le plateau de RTL, Jimmy Mohamed a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© pourquoi.
Si elles apparaissent inoffensives, ces boissons Â« nâ€™aident pas Ã  perdre du poids Â» selon lâ€™expert, Â« les Ã©tudes montrent que les personnes obÃ¨ses buvant des boissons light sans sucres ont tendance Ã  manger plus et Ã  ingurgiter plus de calories Â». En effet, ces breuvages contiennent des Ã©dulcorants artificiels, principalement de lâ€™aspartame et de lâ€™acÃ©sulfame de potassium, qui certes, permettent Ã  la boisson de conserver un faible apport calorique mais trompent le cerveau et le corps en les faisant rÃ©agir comme si du sucre Ã©tait prÃ©sent. Une Ã©tude publiÃ©e dans lâ€™American Journal of Clinical Nutrition a dâ€™ailleurs prouvÃ© que les boissons artificiellement sucrÃ©es Ã©taient associÃ©es Ã  un risque plus Ã©levÃ© de diabÃ¨te de type 2, en particulier chez les femmes.Â« Lorsque vous prenez un Coca Light, votre cerveau pense avoir du sucre et donc vous avez (le sentiment) de rÃ©compense. Le problÃ¨me câ€™est que votre foie et votre pancrÃ©as ne dÃ©tectent pas la hausse du taux du taux de sucre puisque câ€™est une boisson sans sucres. Votre estomac nâ€™y comprend rien. Il ne produit plus dâ€™hormone de satiÃ©tÃ© et vous vous mettez Ã  manger beaucoup plus. Â» explique lâ€™expert.
Cette boisson antioxydante est parfaite pour rÃ©Ã©quilibrer son organisme
Et si vous ne pouvez pas vous empÃªcher de siroter tout au long de la journÃ©e, misez sur des boissons Ã  mÃªme de soutenir votre organisme au quotidien. Lâ€™eau est Ã©videmment de rigueur (nous vous rappelons quâ€™il est recommandÃ© de boire 2L dâ€™eau par jour), mais si vous souhaitez varier, optez pour le thÃ© vert. ApprÃ©ciÃ© depuis plus de 5 000 ans pour ses propriÃ©tÃ©s bÃ©nÃ©fiques pour la santÃ©, le thÃ© vert est riche en composÃ©s vÃ©gÃ©taux protecteurs appelÃ©s polyphÃ©nols et peut alors favoriser la concentration et lâ€™attention, vous procurer une sensation de calme,protÃ©ger le cerveau et stimuler le mÃ©tabolisme. Dâ€™autre part, elle constitue une alternative parfaite pour vous aider Ã  contrÃ´ler votre glycÃ©mie tout en rÃ©duisant le risque de pathologies comme le diabÃ¨te et les maladies cardiaques.

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Hosek in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Hosek says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeÃ±os, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesnâ€™t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.

author: @monicabarberann
title: Thiem y lo peor de medirse a Nadal en Roland Garros: "Es muy frustrante"
text:
Streaming ATP Montpellier en directo
ðŸŽ¾ Yunchaokete Bu vs Felix Auger Aliassime
* Ver y apostar en este partido en directo aquÃ­.
Dominic Thiem y Rafa Nadal nos regalaron una bonita rivalidad que terminÃ³ de manera positiva para el espaÃ±ol con 10 victorias, frente a las 6 del austrÃ­aco. AsÃ­, curiosamente ambos se retiraron en 2024, aÃ±o en el que se vieron las caras por Ãºltima vez en Brisbane. En una reciente entrevista para Relevo, Thiem hablÃ³ de cÃ³mo era enfrentarse al manacorÃ­ en Roland Garros, allÃ­ donde nunca le ha ganado y contra el que perdiÃ³ dos finales en 2018 y 2019. "Sinceramente, ahora, desde la distancia, estoy muy orgulloso de aquellas dos finales contra Ã©l. Jugar una sola final de Grand Slam es un logro increÃ­ble. Es muy complicado llegar hasta ahÃ­. Son dos semanas durÃ­simas de torneo y, si lo pienso, tuve la oportunidad de jugar dos veces contra el mejor jugador de la historia en Roland Garros. Rafa ganÃ³ el torneo 14 veces y dos de ellas lo hizo contra mÃ­. Es algo que me enorgullece".
AsÃ­, Thiem tambiÃ©n hablÃ³ sobre quÃ© era lo peor de enfrentarse a Rafa en la Philippe Chatrier: "Una de las cosas mÃ¡s frustrantes es cuando estÃ¡s calentando en la pista justo antes de que arranque el partido. El speaker empieza a enumerar todos sus tÃ­tulos en Roland Garros [...] El pÃºblico se va volviendo cada vez mÃ¡s loco y el ruido sube, sube y sube. Es muy frustrante para el rival. En realidad es algo maravilloso porque el pÃºblico se enciende y todo se vuelve loco de un momento a otro. EstÃ¡s jugando contra una absoluta leyenda del tenis y cosas como esta no hacen mÃ¡s que corroborarlo, pero sÃ­, en el momento te puedo garantizar que es muy frustrante".
